children.name: owner
children.definition: the person who owns something: người sở hữu , chủ nhân
examples: owner of
I met the owner of the local hotel.
The previous owner painted the outside of the house yellow.
car/dog/home etc owner
Car owners are facing a 10% rise in the price of gasoline.
Dog-owners have been warned to keep their animals under control.
the proud owner of sth
He is the proud owner of two Olympic gold medals.
original/previous/new owner
the club’s new owners
He was nowthe proud owner ofa bright red sports car.
homeowner[C] someone who owns their house or apartment: chủ nhà, chủ hộ
The latest rise in interest rates is bad news for home-owners.
The latest trend is for home-owners to carry out improvements before selling their properties
The new law will benefit many homeowners.

children.name: proprietor
children.definition: formalan owner of a business, especially a small business such as a shop or a restaurant: người chủ, người sở hũu
examples: Eddy Shah, the former national newspaper proprieto
newspaper/garage/cafe etc proprietor
My father had fallen victim to an unscrupulous garage proprietor.
proprietor of
As proprietors of the general store, Mr and Mrs Stacey knew everything that went on in the town
the proprietor of a small hotel and restaurant

children.name: householder
children.definition: formal sb who owns or in charge of a house - used especially in official or legal contexts: chủ nhà, chủ hộ
examples: The police are giving advice to householders on how to improve the security of their homes

children.name: holder
children.definition: sb who owns or controls something :
examples: the 800 m world record holder
Season-ticket holders are furious at the rise in rail fares.
British passport holders
holder of
holders of ordinary shares
